questions.question: Someone cuts you off in traffic and almost causes an accident. Your immediate reaction is:
choices: Lay on the horn and flip them off
Take a deep breath and let it go
Tailgate them for the next 5 miles
Scream every curse word you know

questions.question: You’re fuming after an argument. The fastest thing that actually calms you down is:
choices: Punching something
Counting slowly to 10 (or 100)
Smashing your phone
Ranting to the first person you see

questions.question: Your partner forgets your birthday. Best immediate response:
choices: Ice-cold silent treatment for a week
Calmly say “Hey, that really hurt me”
Explode about every mistake they’ve ever made
Pretend you don’t care while boiling inside

questions.question: Your boss criticizes your work in front of the team. You:
choices: Snap back instantly
Stay quiet, then respond calmly later
Walk out mid-meeting
Plot revenge for months

questions.question: Someone jumps ahead of you in a long line. You usually:
choices: Yell “Learn some manners!” and make a scene
Politely say “Excuse me, the line starts back there”
Glare and mutter under your breath
Post about it online for the next hour

questions.question: The most reliable long-term way you’ve found to get angry less often:
choices: Cut toxic people out completely
Exercise, good sleep, and mindfulness habits
Keep score of every wrong done to you
Always win so no one dares cross you

questions.question: Your kid/spouse makes the same mistake for the 100th time. You:
choices: Scream “Are you stupid or what?!”
Take a timeout, then explain calmly again
Do it yourself while passive-aggressively sighing
Punish them way harder than needed

questions.question: You can usually feel anger rising because you notice:
choices: Nothing until you’ve already exploded
Tight chest, clenched fists, louder voice
It feels good and righteous
You enjoy the adrenaline rush

questions.question: After losing your temper and hurting someone you love, you:
choices: Never apologize—it was their fault
Apologize sincerely and talk about triggers
Say “I’m sorry but you made me…”
Avoid them until they apologize first

questions.question: When anger is completely justified, the healthiest way to express it is:
choices: “I feel ___ when ___ because ___; I need ___”
Sarcasm and eye-rolling
Getting in their face or slamming doors
Swallow it until you blow up later

score.high: Anger Master  Ice in your veins, wisdom in your words—you’ve tamed the beast.
score.medium: Work in Progress  Mostly under control, occasionally volcanic. You’re getting there!
score.low: Human Volcano  One spark and everything burns. Time to learn some new skills before you lose the people you love!
